name: Java
description: Use Java for longer running services or services with constant load. Use Java JDK 11. May be used in some cases for Lambda's, e.g. with Kinesis or Kafka, but Lambda + Java + Spring is a bad option.

name: JS
description: For front-end development

name: Typescript
description: Static typing, forward feature, transcompiled JS

name: Node.js
description: Used for Lambdas or microservices. May be still ok to use for Backend-for-frontend pattern.

name: Scala
description: Used for microservices

name: Python
description: Use for Lambdas

name: Dropwizard/Bluewizard
description: Use SpringBoot instead

name: Play framework
description: Use SpringBoot instead

name: Angular
description: use React instead

name: KCL
description: Use when using Kinesis streams

name: Kafka streams
description: Use KCL instead

name: Dynamo DB
description: For key-value use cases, check on costs for high volume read/writes.

name: EKS
description: For any microservice

name: Kafka/MSK
description: Use Kinesis instead. with Kafka, you need to manage the servers, you can’t scale down partitions (without major efforts), stability of the kafka clusters in regards to rebalancing. Also with Lambda’s Kinesis is way better, as it gives Lambda a queue lookahead and it autoscales faster.

name: Launch Darkly
description: Use to feature toggle all releases

name: Vert.x
description: Use SpringBoot instead

name: Consul
description: Previously used for service-mesh capabilities, but now used primarily for its key/value store

name: Vault
description: Previously used for supporting service-to-service TLS, but now used only for secret management

name: Kotlin
description: Does Kotlin provide enough benefits over Java to switch?

name: Fargate ECS
description: EKS + Fargate = Prefered combination. Can be used to reduce costs for EKS

name: Fargate EKS
description: EKS + Fargate = Prefered combination. Can be used to reduce costs for EKS

name: Spot Instances
description: perferred with Fargate, if not on Fargate on EKS

name: AppMesh
description: Try out and if works well, start using that instead of Istio

name: Lambda
description: For short running tasks and spiky workloads. Good integration with Kinesis for autoscaling and DLQ handling.
